SENT.plain: An 11 year old girl underwent successful transsphenoidal pituitary adenomectomy for pituitary-dependent Cushing's syndrome
Three months after operation, just after stopping glucocorticoid replacement therapy, she developed benign intracranial hypertension
This resolved when exogenous glucocorticoids were restarted but occurred again when they were later stopped
On restarting glucocorticoids again, this second episode of intracranial hypertension resolved
This complication may have been due to the large fall in endogenous cortisol production after removal of her adenoma and subsequent persistent mild endogenous hypocortisolism
